Sentencas: Metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) composed of a Ce(0.8)Sm(0.2)O(22)d (SDC) electrolyte layer and Ni-Ce(0.8)Sm(0.2)O(22)d (Ni-SDC) cermet anode were fabricated by suspension thermal spraying on Hastelloy X substrates.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The cathode, a Sm(0.5)Sr(0.5)CoO(3) (SSCo)-SDC composite, was screen-printed and fired in situ.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The anode was produced by suspension plasma spraying (SPS) using an axial injection plasma torch.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The SDC electrolyte was produced by high-velocity oxy-fuel (HVOF) spraying of liquid suspension feedstock, using propylene fuel (DJ-2700).
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The emerging technology of HVOF suspension spraying was explored here to produce thin and low-porosity electrolytes in an effort to develop a cost-effective and scalable fabrication technique for high-performance, metal-supported SOFCs.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: In-flight particle temperature and velocity were measured for a number of different gun operating conditions and standoff distances and related to the resulting microstructures.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: At optimized conditions, this approach was found to limit material decomposition, enhance deposition efficiency, and reduce defect density in the resulting coating, as compared to previous results reported with SPS.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: Produced button cells showed highly promising performance with a maximum power density (MPD) of 0.5 W cm(-2) at 600 degrees C and above 0.9 W cm(-2) at 700 degrees C, with humidified hydrogen as fuel and air as oxidant.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The potential of this deposition technique to scale-up the substrate size to 50 X 50 mm was demonstrated.
Titulo: Suspension HVOF Spraying of Reduced Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes
